info.name: Reddit web 2.0 but even more pretty (auto width)
info.description: Based on style 33879 but modified slightly to be auto width on your browser, rather than a fixed width which can look too narrow on a widescreen display. Now includes more changes to allow a similar level of usability as vanilla reddit.
info.additionalInfo:
03/05/11
-more fixes thanks to AmericanJesus

25/01/2011
-addressed toolbar display issue (thanks AmericanJesus)
-a couple of other tweaks that I forgot to note

11/01/2011
-fixed domain name positioning when story titles stop near a line break
-added back rank display
-fixed display of help for sponsored links
-probably something else that I forgot to write down

21/12/2010
-made sponsored links look nicer
-got gold so adjusted the 'show more comments' and 'new comments' sections to fit the style

16/12/2010
-added some missing "!important" and missing border-radius values

01/12/2010
-re-added story separator line
-made story spacing tighter to try and find a happy medium between the functionality of vanilla reddit and the Web2.0 mockup

30/11/2010
-cleaned up some selectors
-fixed an issue with subreddit titles being displayed twice and overlaid
-improved the reddit bar styling
-stopped using segoe ui for the search box
-cleaned up the border curves to be more consistent and removed practically invisible shadowing
-switched from PX to EM sizes where possible
-made the styling apply to a few more places, like the edit My Reddits screen
-increased the font size of domain name and submitter info
-probably a couple of other things that I didn't note down

08/11/2010
-Changed the position of the userbar and comment/options display on stories to look more like the mockup. The userbar could go level with the tabmenu but on narrower displays they can overlap
-emboldened story titles - i'm not sure about the visited link colour and will look into changing it.

08/11/2010
-Changed upvote/downvote arrows to use CSS sprites to save on style install size and reduce duplication
-Updated the arrow images to have a transparent background so they upcoming links background doesn't break them
-Added a little padding to the right of the story titles so they feel more 'central' due to the padding that the votes and thumbnail introduce;
 this also fixes the upcoming links navigation arrows being drawn over the titles

06/11/2010
-Moved the reddit logo, menu and stories up so they waste less screen space and fit better with subreddit backgrounds

05/11/2010
-Optimised CSS selectors and notation for compatibility with Webkit and future browsers.
-Stopped trying to use Segoe UI as it can break upvotes display.
